column2: Doxxing is dangerous.
column44: Lifetime Twitter Ban for Eve Barlow
column51: Lifetime Twitter Ban for Eve Barlow
column52:
Eve Barlow, a journalist and current romantic partner of Amber Heard has allegedly been doxxing YouTubers such as, ThatUmbrellaGuy, DUIGuy+, Emily D. Baker, and others for covering the Depp vs. Heard 2022 trail in Fairfax, Virginia. Eve has been very vocal on Twitter in particular, slandering supporters of Plantiff, John C. Depp. Eve has allegedly gone as far as collecting private, sensitive information of the YouTubers mentioned above and leaking their names, addresses, past work places and more. 

What is Doxxing? 

“Doxxing is the collection and publishing of someone’s private information online, usually done with the intent of inciting harassment in real life. While not technically illegal, it’s considered harassment by most people, and there have been bills proposed to make it a crime.”

 

Adam Waldman, former lawyer of Johnny Depp had been tweeting previously about the pending trail against the UK SUN newspaper back in 2019/2020 and a witness of the trail, Amber Heard. Twitter provided Mr. Waldman with a lifetime ban for these tweets calling Ms. Heard’s DV/SA allegations a “hoax”, and “false”. 

In the Depp vs. Heard 2022 trial, held in Fairfax, Virginia, Eve Barlow was barred from the courtroom for the duration of the trial after live tweeting in the court room and presenting a falsified Instagram post from one of the plaintiffs witnesses to the defendants lawyers. At the conclusion of the trail, it was found that the defendants statements were false and had a defamatory implication. She was found libel for all 3 counts brought against her for defamation. Plaintiff, Johnny Depp was found libel for 1/3 statements made by Adam Waldman while he was acting as an agent for Mr. Depp. 

All of us in The United States of America are free to have an opinion. We are all party to free speech. We can say, have always been able to say, and will continue to say whatever we please and wherever we please. However, there are and should be consequences if that speech is false, defamatory or done with actual malice.

column2: Don't know or care if she is just a friend or lover of Amber Heard, but I do care that she doxxes. Outside of a criminal case, people have a right to privacy, even if we don't like them.

All of us in The United States of America are free to have an opinion. We are all party to free speech. We can say, have always been able to say, and will continue to say whatever we please and wherever we please. However, there are and should be consequences if that speech is false, defamatory or done with actual malice.

Eve Barlow, a journalist and current romantic partner of Amber Heard has allegedly been doxxing YouTubers such as, ThatUmbrellaGuy, DUIGuy+, Emily D. Baker, and others for covering the Depp vs. Heard 2022 trail in Fairfax, Virginia. Eve has been very vocal on Twitter in particular, slandering supporters of Plantiff, John C. Depp. Eve has allegedly gone as far as collecting private, sensitive information of the YouTubers mentioned above and leaking their names, addresses, past work places and more. 

What is Doxxing? 

“Doxxing is the collection and publishing of someone’s private information online, usually done with the intent of inciting harassment in real life. While not technically illegal, it’s considered harassment by most people, and there have been bills proposed to make it a crime.”

Twitter provided Mr. Waldman with a lifetime ban for these tweets calling Ms. Heard’s DV/SA allegations a “hoax”, and “false”. 

In the Depp vs. Heard 2022 trial, held in Fairfax, Virginia, Eve Barlow was barred from the courtroom for the duration of the trial after live tweeting in the court room and presenting a falsified Instagram post from one of the plaintiffs witnesses to the defendants lawyers. At the conclusion of the trail, it was found that the defendants statements were false and had a defamatory implication. She was found libel for all 3 counts brought against her for defamation. Plaintiff, Johnny Depp was found libel for 1/3 statements made by Adam Waldman while he was acting as an agent for Mr. Depp.
